metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15682 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: When a link to an external protocol was clicked, a prompt was presentedthat allowed the user to choose what application to open it in. An attackercould induce that prompt to be associated with an origin they didn'tcontrol, resulting in a spoofing attack. This was fixed by changingexternal protocol prompts to be tab-modal while also ensuring they couldnot be incorrectly associated with a different origin. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 82.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
